description.narrative: For strengthened the economic and social power of nine rural women's organizations in the Koutiala cotton region of Mali. Four groups bought eight tons of karite nuts to process and sell shea butter. Four other groups bought 16 pedal pumps for market gardening. One group bought five 200-litre barrels of cotton oil to make artisanal soap for sale. ADAP built the capacity of the nine groups in financial management and marketing; in rights advocacy; in how to present their agricultural products at two agricultural fairs; and in learning from each other through organized information exchanges. The grant strengthened the capacity of ADAP to monitor and learn from their work. The goals of the grant were to increase the capacity of nine rural women's organizations to add value to raw agricultural products; increase the capacity of nine rural women's organizations to advocate for the rights of their members; and increase the institutional capacity of ADAP to monitor and learn from the results of their work.
